required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study to Assess the Effectiveness of an Atrial Fibrillation (AF) Risk Prediction Algorithm and Diagnostic Test in Identifying Patients With AF.
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomised Controlled Trial for the Identification of Undiagnosed Atrial Fibrillation Patients Using a Machine Learning Risk Prediction Algorithm and Diagnostic Test

brief_summary.textblock: This is a trial to assess the effectiveness of an atrial fibrillation (AF) risk prediction algorithm and diagnostic test for the identification of patients with atrial fibrillation

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of participants with diagnosed Atrial Fibrillation during the research window in control and intervention arms
primary_outcome.time_frame: From the first collection of patient medical records at the beginning of the trial to the last collection of patient records following the intervention at the end of the trial (Up to 6 months)
primary_outcome.description: Prevalence of AF in the research window assessed

secondary_outcome.measure: Expected healthcare resource utilisation (Annual maintenance costs related to health states (informed by the primary endpoint), and daily treatment costs (including monitoring))

arm_group.description: The AF risk prediction algorithm will be run on patient records within the Egton Medical Information Systems (EMIS) data base, in order to identify patients at risk of developing AF
Patients may be diagnosed with AF through routine clinical practice only

study_pop.textblock:
It is anticipated that approximately 18,000 patient records will be included in the trial.
It is anticipated that approximately 1,200 undiagnosed patients would be invited for AF diagnosis across all study sites.30 years is taken as the minimum age entry criteria as the algorithm was built on information from patients >30 years where AF becomes more prevalent.

overall_contact.last_name: Recruiting sites have contact information. Please contact the sites directly. If there is no contact information,

overall_contact_backup.last_name: First line of the email MUST contain NCT # and Site #.
